ranked_diseases.explanation: Patient shows key features matching all three reference cases: jaundice, feeding difficulties, hypotonia, abnormality of coagulation cascade, and specifically depletion of mitochondrial DNA in liver. The age (15 months) and hepatic involvement are characteristic of this condition.
Also presents with hepatocerebral involvement, jaundice, coagulation abnormalities, and hypotonia. DGUOK mutations cause this variant with similar presentation but typically earlier onset.
Can present with liver involvement, hypotonia, and feeding difficulties. However, typically has more prominent neurological features and later onset of liver disease.
Shares hypotonia and feeding difficulties but primarily affects muscle rather than liver. Hepatic involvement and jaundice are not typical features.
Can present with liver dysfunction, jaundice, and failure to thrive in infancy. However, typically includes severe anemia and pancreatic insufficiency not mentioned in this case.
